title: panic with "WARNING: Error starting the main Syncthing process: exec: "syncthing.exe": cannot run executable found relative to current directory" when starting v1.21.0-rc.1 in command line in Windows

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: skip-changelog
labels.description: Bugs that have never been in a released stable version, and as such excluded from the release notes

body:
This happens if you try to start the current RC from the command line in Windows.

```
R:\syncthing-windows-amd64-v1.21.0-rc.1>syncthing.exe
[monitor] 2022/08/13 15:32:57 INFO: Log output saved to file "C:\Users\User\AppData\Local\Syncthing\syncthing.log"
[monitor] 2022/08/13 15:32:57 WARNING: Error starting the main Syncthing process: exec: "syncthing.exe": cannot run executable found relative to current directory
panic: Error starting the main Syncthing process

goroutine 1 [running]:
main.monitorMain({{{0x0}, {0x0, 0x0}, {0x0, 0x0}, 0x0, 0x0}, 0x0, 0x0, {0x0, ...}, ...})
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/monitor.go:124 +0x110f
main.serveOptions.Run({{{0x0}, {0x0, 0x0}, {0x0, 0x0}, 0x0, 0x0}, 0x0, 0x0, {0x0, ...}, ...})
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/main.go:404 +0x798
reflect.Value.call({0x10df7c0?, 0x1a8c660?, 0xf13515?}, {0x10ed8d2, 0x4}, {0xc0001dbb80, 0x0, 0x645948?})
        reflect/value.go:584 +0x8c5
reflect.Value.Call({0x10df7c0?, 0x1a8c660?, 0xfde580?}, {0xc0001dbb80?, 0x10?, 0x1a8caa0?})
        reflect/value.go:368 +0xbc
github.com/alecthomas/kong.callMethod({0x10ed2c7, 0x3}, {0x10df7c0?, 0x1a8c660?, 0x3?}, {0x10df7c0?, 0x1a8c660?, 0x0?}, 0x0?)
        github.com/alecthomas/kong@v0.6.1/callbacks.go:95 +0x549
github.com/alecthomas/kong.(*Context).RunNode(0xc000160d80, 0xc0001262d0, {0x0, 0x0, 0x0})
        github.com/alecthomas/kong@v0.6.1/context.go:734 +0x5f7
github.com/alecthomas/kong.(*Context).Run(0xf6efe0?, {0x0?, 0x0?, 0x0?})
        github.com/alecthomas/kong@v0.6.1/context.go:759 +0x14e
main.main()
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/main.go:255 +0x3a5

goroutine 6 [chan receive]:
github.com/syncthing/notify.(*recursiveTree).dispatch(0xc00007c7d0)
        github.com/syncthing/notify@v0.0.0-20210616190510-c6b7342338d2/tree_recursive.go:125 +0x48
created by github.com/syncthing/notify.newRecursiveTree
        github.com/syncthing/notify@v0.0.0-20210616190510-c6b7342338d2/tree_recursive.go:119 +0x165

goroutine 7 [sleep]:
time.Sleep(0x1dcd6500)
        runtime/time.go:195 +0x13c
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/dialer.init.0.func2()
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/dialer/internal.go:43 +0x1e
created by github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/dialer.init.0
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/dialer/internal.go:42 +0xbe

goroutine 8 [select]:
main.(*autoclosedFile).closerLoop(0xc000247c00)
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/monitor.go:528 +0x71
created by main.newAutoclosedFile
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/cmd/syncthing/monitor.go:468 +0x1e5

goroutine 9 [syscall]:
os/signal.signal_recv()
        runtime/sigqueue.go:152 +0x2f
os/signal.loop()
        os/signal/signal_unix.go:23 +0x19
created by os/signal.Notify.func1.1
        os/signal/signal.go:151 +0x2a
```

The workaround is to use `.\syncthing.exe`, but this wasn't the case before when compiled with Go 1.18. I personally think it is a big problem, because this requirement is very likely to break custom scripts, especially since using `.\` isn't common in batch scripts at all (as it's optional and thus usually omitted).
